channel.title: Can a teamspeak server be hosted on a web server
channel.description:
i'm sorry if this was stupid, i'm a real noob at hosting and whatnot. I'm just interested in hosting a teamspeak server ( a voice chat program) can I host something like this? Lets say i purchased like 4 gigs from someone, could i host it off that? If so, know anyone who is sub-hosting ( or whatever you call it, where they buy a chunk and then sell off other chunks ) for a year for moderately cheap?
thanks, i'm sorry if this was absurd or i said something stupid.

item.title: Can a teamspeak server be hosted on a web server
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

ok thanks, i just thought it might work somewhat like shoutcast, no-ip.org was kinda wacky for me before. thanks though

Read full topic
item.source: Can a teamspeak server be hosted on a web server

item.title: Can a teamspeak server be hosted on a web server
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

weaselforce:

The problem is i have a dynamic ip address, I really want something remote.

no-ip.org is a solution to your dynamic IP.
No it will not effect your internet in anyway other way, but your best bet is just to pay for a teamspeek server. I am pretty sure that webhosting cannot run it.

Read full topic
item.source: Can a teamspeak server be hosted on a web server

item.title: Can a teamspeak server be hosted on a web server
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

If you own a dedicated server then yes

Webhosting however does not allow you to run an application remotely and whatnot, so I would asume not. Check with your hosting company? You could always use your home computer if you have a fast connection.

Read full topic
item.source: Can a teamspeak server be hosted on a web server

item.title: Can a teamspeak server be hosted on a web server
item.dc:creator: @daycrawler daycrawler
item.description:
@daycrawler wrote:

Sub-hosting… You can have subdomains… Also, Like for my website I have 3 websites running off of one hosting program, you just can’t go over the limit…

Read full topic
